page.title: 11From a Cheam Boy:1985
page.content: Cheam is one of the oldest preparatory schools in the country.It started life in{Surrey in 1645}and moved to{Headley in 1934. This feepaying school has about 140 boys and has very good facilities, which include a big sports hall and squash court,an up to date computer room and a music school. The main academic studies are English,Maths,French,Science and Latin.I rate Cheam as a very well equipped school with all that you would need for work and recreation. There is a wide choice of things to do,ranging from almost any sport to {dibs and marbles. Cheam has a chain of monitors who with the staff run the school and organise the younger boys, achieving a high academic standard and fully preparing pupils for Public School.
